title: Mama Earth Organics hiring Growth Marketing Manager in Toronto, Ontario, Canada
content_text:
Our Story Mama Earth is a food experience for people who love to eat, cook, share, and learn about food. Our mission is to help you better the world through your food choices. We provide fresh, local organic produce, chef-crafted meals, sustainable meat and seafood, and everyday essentials, all conveniently delivered to your door with flexible options across the Greater Toronto Area and beyond.
Job title: Growth Marketing ManagerSalary: $85,000 - $90,000 AnnuallyPosition Type: Full-TimeDepartment: MarketingLocation: TBD, Riverside or Downtown Toronto (Hybrid, 1-2 days per week in office)
What's In It For You:You’ll be joining a team of talented, fun people who take pride in pushing good food forwardComprehensive benefits health and dental benefits package with EAPMostly remote with office optionEmployee discounts at Mama EarthYou’ll be supporting the creation of a local food system, built on principles of sustainability and biodiversity, and demonstrating that this can be both financially sustainable for farmers and affordable for consumers
Who You Are:
We’re looking for a roll-up-your-sleeves growth marketer whose main mission is to grow signups and build brand love across paid, owned, earned, grassroots channels, and our community (especially since word-of-mouth is one of our most powerful tools). You’re just as comfortable crafting strategy as you are executing it yourself, whether that means writing ad copy, building landing pages, optimizing funnels, or pulling performance data. You thrive in a fast-moving, collaborative environment where everyone pitches in, and you see every touchpoint as an opportunity to connect people to great food and the farmers who grow it. Data drives your decisions, but you know the real magic happens when performance meets emotional storytelling.
What you will be doing: 
Acquisition Strategy & Performance MarketingOwn the customer acquisition strategy, with new customer signups as your North Star Metric.Lead and optimize paid media (Meta, Google, TikTok, emerging platforms) in partnership with agencies.Monitor campaigns and KPIs daily, pivoting quickly to improve CPA, ROAS, and payback period.Build and execute a testing roadmap across creative, landing pages, and new channels.Build and optimize prospect-focused email automations, popups, and SMS.Continually assess and evolve our acquisition model for efficiency and growth.
Onsite Optimization & CRODrive onsite optimization for acquisition, including landing page creation, funnel improvements, SEO, and LLM opportunities.Collaborate with developers to run CRO tests and implement high-impact changes.Manage product merchandising strategies to maximize conversion.
Data, Analytics & ForecastingBuild and monitor dashboards in Metabase, GA4 and Google Sheets, surfacing actionable insights.Forecast acquisition volume and spend; track and report on progress weekly.Align agencies and internal teams on attribution and measurement.
Partnerships & ActivationsOversee the Partnerships & Activations Manager to deliver grassroots acquisition at healthy CPAs.Support with setup, collateral, logistics, and strategic partner negotiations.
Collaboration, Budget & StorytellingLead agency relationships, manage budgets, and ensure accurate expense tracking.Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver a cohesive journey from first touch to first order.Partner with purchasing and creative teams to deliver campaigns that combine performance with storytelling rooted in food, farming, and community.
What you will bring to the table: 5+ years in growth marketing, acquisition, or performance roles, ideally in DTC, subscription, or e-commerce.A proven track record of meeting or exceeding CPA and acquisition targets while managing multi-channel paid media portfolios.Hands-on experience building campaigns across Meta, Google, TikTok (and emerging platforms)Comfort with analytics tools like GA4 and Metabase or Tableau (Nice to have: SQL)Strong grasp of onsite optimization: From SEO and landing pages to CRO testing and funnel design, and the ability to execute or directly oversee implementation.Experience creating email automation, SMS, and popup campaigns aimed at converting prospects.High level of comfort managing external agencies and vendors while also executing work yourself.Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable strategies and clear reporting for stakeholders.A knack for balancing performance metrics with emotional storytelling that connects with audiences.Strong project management skills, including budget tracking, invoice management, and cross-team collaboration.Bonus: Familiarity with food, agriculture, sustainability, or local food systems.
Working Conditions:Ability to lift up to 40 lbs and travel locally for in-person events or activations.This role is based in Riverside or Downtown Toronto (TBD) with a hybrid work model. It is mostly remote, with one to two days in office per week and occasional in-person attendance at events, pop-ups, or partner locations.
Our CommitmentWe thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.Mama Earth Organics  is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, and Indigenous status. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.
content_html:
Our Story

Mama Earth is a food experience for people who love to eat, cook, share, and learn about food. Our mission is to help you better the world through your food choices. We provide fresh, local organic produce, chef-crafted meals, sustainable meat and seafood, and everyday essentials, all conveniently delivered to your door with flexible options across the Greater Toronto Area and beyond.


Job title: Growth Marketing Manager

Salary: $85,000 - $90,000 Annually

Position Type: Full-Time

Department: Marketing

Location: TBD, Riverside or Downtown Toronto (Hybrid, 1-2 days per week in office)


What's In It For You:

  • You’ll be joining a team of talented, fun people who take pride in pushing good food forward
  • Comprehensive benefits health and dental benefits package with EAP
  • Mostly remote with office option
  • Employee discounts at Mama Earth
  • You’ll be supporting the creation of a local food system, built on principles of sustainability and biodiversity, and demonstrating that this can be both financially sustainable for farmers and affordable for consumers


Who You Are:


We’re looking for a roll-up-your-sleeves growth marketer whose main mission is to grow signups and build brand love across paid, owned, earned, grassroots channels, and our community (especially since word-of-mouth is one of our most powerful tools). You’re just as comfortable crafting strategy as you are executing it yourself, whether that means writing ad copy, building landing pages, optimizing funnels, or pulling performance data. You thrive in a fast-moving, collaborative environment where everyone pitches in, and you see every touchpoint as an opportunity to connect people to great food and the farmers who grow it. Data drives your decisions, but you know the real magic happens when performance meets emotional storytelling.


What you will be doing: 


Acquisition Strategy & Performance Marketing

  • Own the customer acquisition strategy, with new customer signups as your North Star Metric.
  • Lead and optimize paid media (Meta, Google, TikTok, emerging platforms) in partnership with agencies.
  • Monitor campaigns and KPIs daily, pivoting quickly to improve CPA, ROAS, and payback period.
  • Build and execute a testing roadmap across creative, landing pages, and new channels.
  • Build and optimize prospect-focused email automations, popups, and SMS.
  • Continually assess and evolve our acquisition model for efficiency and growth.


Onsite Optimization & CRO

  • Drive onsite optimization for acquisition, including landing page creation, funnel improvements, SEO, and LLM opportunities.
  • Collaborate with developers to run CRO tests and implement high-impact changes.
  • Manage product merchandising strategies to maximize conversion.


Data, Analytics & Forecasting

  • Build and monitor dashboards in Metabase, GA4 and Google Sheets, surfacing actionable insights.
  • Forecast acquisition volume and spend; track and report on progress weekly.
  • Align agencies and internal teams on attribution and measurement.


Partnerships & Activations

  • Oversee the Partnerships & Activations Manager to deliver grassroots acquisition at healthy CPAs.
  • Support with setup, collateral, logistics, and strategic partner negotiations.


Collaboration, Budget & Storytelling

  • Lead agency relationships, manage budgets, and ensure accurate expense tracking.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally to deliver a cohesive journey from first touch to first order.
  • Partner with purchasing and creative teams to deliver campaigns that combine performance with storytelling rooted in food, farming, and community.


What you will bring to the table: 

  • 5+ years in growth marketing, acquisition, or performance roles, ideally in DTC, subscription, or e-commerce.
  • A proven track record of meeting or exceeding CPA and acquisition targets while managing multi-channel paid media portfolios.
  • Hands-on experience building campaigns across Meta, Google, TikTok (and emerging platforms)
  • Comfort with analytics tools like GA4 and Metabase or Tableau (Nice to have: SQL)
  • Strong grasp of onsite optimization: From SEO and landing pages to CRO testing and funnel design, and the ability to execute or directly oversee implementation.
  • Experience creating email automation, SMS, and popup campaigns aimed at converting prospects.
  • High level of comfort managing external agencies and vendors while also executing work yourself.
  • Advanced analytical skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable strategies and clear reporting for stakeholders.
  • A knack for balancing performance metrics with emotional storytelling that connects with audiences.
  • Strong project management skills, including budget tracking, invoice management, and cross-team collaboration.
  • Bonus: Familiarity with food, agriculture, sustainability, or local food systems.


Working Conditions:

  • Ability to lift up to 40 lbs and travel locally for in-person events or activations.
  • This role is based in Riverside or Downtown Toronto (TBD) with a hybrid work model. It is mostly remote, with one to two days in office per week and occasional in-person attendance at events, pop-ups, or partner locations.


Our Commitment

We thank all interested applicants; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Mama Earth Organics  is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity and inclusion. We consider all applicants regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, and Indigenous status. If you require accommodation during the recruitment and selection process, please let us know. We will work with you to provide as seamless a recruitment experience as possible.

title: TEEMA hiring Data Analytics Specialist in Vancouver, British Columbia, Canada
content_text:
Location: Vancouver, BC (Hybrid – 50% on-site)Contract: 6 months (high likelihood of permanent)
We’re looking for a Data Analytics Specialist to join our team on a 6-month contract with a strong possibility of transitioning into a full-time permanent role. This role is ideal for someone who loves working with data analysis, insights, and reporting rather than heavy backend data engineering.
About the RoleIn this role, you’ll focus on building out notebooks and working with gold layers and semantic layers to deliver clear and actionable insights. You’ll spend your time developing data visualizations and dashboards in Power BI, manipulating data for meaningful analysis, and supporting stakeholders with event analytics and decision-making.
This is a hands-on analytics role — you’ll work closely with business teams, supporting projects and retiring legacy reporting systems while helping to evolve our modern analytics stack.
Key Skills & ExperienceWe’re seeking someone with strong analytics and visualization expertise, including:
Power BI and Power Query (hands-on dashboards, reports, semantic modeling)SQL Server & SSIS plus Azure analytics tools (Azure Synapse, Data Factory, Azure SQL)Experience working with gold layers and semantic layersNotebooks for manipulating datasets and producing insightsAt least 1+ years experience with Microsoft Fabric in an enterprise environment T-SQL programming and JSONStrong ability to analyze, synthesize, and interpret data to produce actionable business insightsExcellent communication skills — comfortable presenting findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders
content_html:
Location: Vancouver, BC (Hybrid – 50% on-site)

Contract: 6 months (high likelihood of permanent)


We’re looking for a Data Analytics Specialist to join our team on a 6-month contract with a strong possibility of transitioning into a full-time permanent role. This role is ideal for someone who loves working with data analysis, insights, and reporting rather than heavy backend data engineering.


About the Role

In this role, you’ll focus on building out notebooks and working with gold layers and semantic layers to deliver clear and actionable insights. You’ll spend your time developing data visualizations and dashboards in Power BI, manipulating data for meaningful analysis, and supporting stakeholders with event analytics and decision-making.


This is a hands-on analytics role — you’ll work closely with business teams, supporting projects and retiring legacy reporting systems while helping to evolve our modern analytics stack.


Key Skills & Experience

We’re seeking someone with strong analytics and visualization expertise, including:


  • Power BI and Power Query (hands-on dashboards, reports, semantic modeling)
  • SQL Server & SSIS plus Azure analytics tools (Azure Synapse, Data Factory, Azure SQL)
  • Experience working with gold layers and semantic layers
  • Notebooks for manipulating datasets and producing insights
  • At least 1+ years experience with Microsoft Fabric in an enterprise environment
  • T-SQL programming and JSON
  • Strong ability to analyze, synthesize, and interpret data to produce actionable business insights
  • Excellent communication skills — comfortable presenting findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders

title: Aliments Krispy Kernels hiring Analyste prix de revient in Québec, Quebec, Canada
content_text:
Ta job alléchante chez Aliments Krispy Kernels!

Du genre pinottes ou pistaches? Il y a de la place pour tout le monde chez Krispy Kernels. Et surtout, on a de la place pour toi. L’ingrédient manquant dans notre recette du succès ? Un(e) Analyste prix de revient à temps plein, basé(e) à nos bureaux de Québec.

Tu as l'esprit de rigueur, un bon sens de l’analyse et tu veux t’investir dans une entreprise québécoise qui a du croquant depuis 1964 ? Lis bien ce qui suit.

La saveur que tu apportes à l’équipe : En tant qu’Analyste du prix d revient, tu joueras un rôle clé au sein de notre organisation. Relevant du VP Finances, tu seras responsable d'effectuer différentes tâches en comptabilité de gestion.

Profite D'avantages Aussi Savoureux Que Nos Grignotines

Salaire compétitif pour te récompenser à ta juste valeurProgramme d’aide aux employé.es (PAE) pour te soutenir au quotidienAccès à la plateforme de télémédecine DialogueAssurance collective, y compris dentaire avec contribution de l’employeurTravail à domicile possible lorsque la formation sera terminée (un peu de flexibilité, ça fait du bien !)

Ta recette de responsabilités

Analyser, établir et mettre à jour les prix de revientGénérer plusieurs analyses de rentabilitéValidation du coût de revient dans le nouveau ERPParticiper à l’élaboration des budgets annuelsAnalyse des variances et des écarts (budget, production, coût)Participer aux revues de performance avec les unités d’affairesGestion de la donnée financièreParticiper à la mise en place et suivi d’indicateurs de performanceProposer des améliorations aux divers processus d’affaires en lien le déploiement du nouveau ERPParticiper à toutes autres responsabilités et projets permettant au département des finances de réaliser ses objectifsAssurer un rôle de leadership dans la gestion du département des finances

Ton sac à compétences contient-il les assaisonnements que l’on recherche ?

Nous Recherchons Un(e) Candidat(e) Qui Possède

Une formation universitaire en sciences de la comptabilité.Un minimum de 6 ans d’expérience dans un poste similaire, idéalement en environnement manufacturier ou de distributionConnaissance des systèmes ERP (Microsoft Dynamics BC/Navision) – un atout.Une excellente maîtrise de la suite Microsoft Office (Excel, Word, Outlook, Teams) .Une rigueur et une minutie exemplaires, assurant la précision des analyses et la qualité des livrables.Une approche collaborative, axée sur le partenariat avec les unités d’affaires et les services internes, favorisant une compréhension commune des enjeux et une prise de décision éclairée.D’excellentes aptitudes communicationnelles et un sens du leadershipUne capacité à vulgariser et à synthétiser l’information financièreUn esprit analytique développé et une bonne capacité d’évaluation, combinés à une organisation efficace.Un sens des priorités affûté et la capacité de gérer plusieurs projets simultanément.

Prêt(e) à rejoindre notre équipe craquante ?

Si tu veux faire partie d'une recette gagnante et que tu carbures aux défis, envoie-nous ta candidature dès maintenant. Chez Krispy Kernels, ton potentiel est notre recette secrète !

title: Techso hiring DELMIA Solution Architect/ Digital Manufacturing in Montreal, Quebec, Canada
content_text:
A global leader in digital transformation, Techso is a fast-growing company offering consulting services in three niches of expertise: technology infrastructure management (IT), specific application development (DEV) and product lifecycle management (PLM).

Founded in 2014, Techso has built a reputation for the quality of its projects delivered to prestigious customers in various sectors such as automotive, aerospace, events, watchmaking, finance and many others.

Techso is looking to expand its PLM team. You will work as a DELMIA/Digital Manufacturing Solution Architect to advise, define and deliver solutions for major projects in France, Montreal or abroad.

Responsibilities

Techso is looking to strengthen its expertise in Dassault Systèmes' 3DEXPERIENCE tool by recruiting a DELMIA Solution Architect to meet the needs of its Montreal-based customers.

As a Solution Architect, you will be in direct contact with the customer, defining the solution architecture and the physical and organizational business perimeter.You will contribute to the design and evolution of the enterprise application, information and technology architecture.You will draw up transition plans between current and target architectures, and recommend the implementation of the resulting projects.You will consolidate project requirements and act as your customer's main contact throughout all phases of the project.You will advise, guide and support the business areas in matters of architecture for global integration.You will find the best solutions for the customer, in partnership with the publisher, whether OOTB or custom solutions.

Skills Required

Bachelor's degree in mechanics, industry or ITYou have significant experience in the world of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) - at least 6 yearsYou have a sound knowledge of Dassault Systèmes tools, in particular 3DEXPERIENCE (ENOVIA, CATIA, DELMIA) or Apriso, Ortems and QuintiqYou are familiar with the various applications in DELMIA: "Manufacturing Item Definition", "Work Instruction", "Process Planner", "Robotics", etc. You have already led meetings with different groups in the organization to clarify requirements and deploy the chosen solutions.You have already facilitated meetings with different groups within the organization to clarify needs and the deployment of selected solutionsYou have been able to evolve in an Agile/Scrum environmentYou are able to communicate in English, both written and spoken, as some of your customers will be English-speakingYou wish to evolve in an international environment and be able to work abroad according to our customers' requests (Europe, Asia, Canada, France)Some projects may be subject to defense clearance constraints.

Benefits

A hybrid telecommuting policy: we adapt to the customerA beautiful workspace located in the heart of Old Montreal with a terraceBreakfast, coffee, snacks and beer are available at the officeAn active social club with several activities budgeted by Techso (camping, cottage, cruise, Christmas party, etc.).The opportunity to travel - a lump sum for mobile consultantsThe opportunity to get involved in exciting in-house projectsA team of experts to share their expertise with youPrivate group insurance
content_html:
A global leader in digital transformation, Techso is a fast-growing company offering consulting services in three niches of expertise: technology infrastructure management (IT), specific application development (DEV) and product lifecycle management (PLM).

Founded in 2014, Techso has built a reputation for the quality of its projects delivered to prestigious customers in various sectors such as automotive, aerospace, events, watchmaking, finance and many others.

Techso is looking to expand its PLM team. You will work as a DELMIA/Digital Manufacturing Solution Architect to advise, define and deliver solutions for major projects in France, Montreal or abroad.

Responsibilities

Techso is looking to strengthen its expertise in Dassault Systèmes' 3DEXPERIENCE tool by recruiting a DELMIA Solution Architect to meet the needs of its Montreal-based customers.

  • As a Solution Architect, you will be in direct contact with the customer, defining the solution architecture and the physical and organizational business perimeter.
  • You will contribute to the design and evolution of the enterprise application, information and technology architecture.
  • You will draw up transition plans between current and target architectures, and recommend the implementation of the resulting projects.
  • You will consolidate project requirements and act as your customer's main contact throughout all phases of the project.
  • You will advise, guide and support the business areas in matters of architecture for global integration.
  • You will find the best solutions for the customer, in partnership with the publisher, whether OOTB or custom solutions.

Skills Required

  • Bachelor's degree in mechanics, industry or IT
  • You have significant experience in the world of Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) - at least 6 years
  • You have a sound knowledge of Dassault Systèmes tools, in particular 3DEXPERIENCE (ENOVIA, CATIA, DELMIA) or Apriso, Ortems and Quintiq
  • You are familiar with the various applications in DELMIA: "Manufacturing Item Definition", "Work Instruction", "Process Planner", "Robotics", etc. You have already led meetings with different groups in the organization to clarify requirements and deploy the chosen solutions.
  • You have already facilitated meetings with different groups within the organization to clarify needs and the deployment of selected solutions
  • You have been able to evolve in an Agile/Scrum environment
  • You are able to communicate in English, both written and spoken, as some of your customers will be English-speaking
  • You wish to evolve in an international environment and be able to work abroad according to our customers' requests (Europe, Asia, Canada, France)
  • Some projects may be subject to defense clearance constraints.

Benefits

  • A hybrid telecommuting policy: we adapt to the customer
  • A beautiful workspace located in the heart of Old Montreal with a terrace
  • Breakfast, coffee, snacks and beer are available at the office
  • An active social club with several activities budgeted by Techso (camping, cottage, cruise, Christmas party, etc.).
  • The opportunity to travel - a lump sum for mobile consultants
  • The opportunity to get involved in exciting in-house projects
  • A team of experts to share their expertise with you
  • Private group insurance

title: Creative Niche hiring Senior Product Manager in Toronto, Ontario, Canada
content_text:
We’re seeking a skilled and strategic Senior Product Manager to lead the development and growth of innovative financial products for our established fintech client. In this role, you'll take full ownership of the product lifecycle - from discovery and planning to launch and continuous improvement. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver products that are data-informed, customer-centric, and built to scale. A background in fintech and working with modern technologies is a plus.
Key Responsibilities:• Full Lifecycle Ownership: Lead the end-to-end product process - from idea to execution - ensuring successful outcomes for both customers and the business.• Strategic Planning: Develop and communicate product vision, define roadmaps, and prioritize features based on market needs, user feedback, and business goals.• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, compliance, data, and operations teams to bring product ideas to life.• Customer Focus: Conduct user research, gather insights, and use data to deeply understand customer needs and drive meaningful product decisions.• Data-Informed Product Development: Leverage analytics and experimentation to validate assumptions, optimize performance, and support product iterations.• Tech & Innovation: Partner with data and engineering teams to explore and implement advanced features.• Regulatory Awareness: Ensure product decisions align with industry regulations and data privacy standards.
Qualifications:• Experience: 5-8 years of product management experience, ideally in financial related industries.• Lifecycle Expertise: Proven track record leading products through the full lifecycle in agile environments.• Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with comfort working with metrics, experimentation, and customer data.• Technical Aptitude: Ability to work effectively with engineering and data teams; familiarity with concepts like APIs, data flows, and algorithmic features is helpful.• Collaboration & Communication: Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills; strong ability to influence and align teams through storytelling and product narratives.We look forward to hearing from you.

We’re seeking a skilled and strategic Senior Product Manager to lead the development and growth of innovative financial products for our established fintech client. In this role, you'll take full ownership of the product lifecycle - from discovery and planning to launch and continuous improvement. You’ll collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to deliver products that are data-informed, customer-centric, and built to scale. A background in fintech and working with modern technologies is a plus.


Key Responsibilities:

• Full Lifecycle Ownership: Lead the end-to-end product process - from idea to execution - ensuring successful outcomes for both customers and the business.

• Strategic Planning: Develop and communicate product vision, define roadmaps, and prioritize features based on market needs, user feedback, and business goals.

• Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with engineering, design, compliance, data, and operations teams to bring product ideas to life.

• Customer Focus: Conduct user research, gather insights, and use data to deeply understand customer needs and drive meaningful product decisions.

• Data-Informed Product Development: Leverage analytics and experimentation to validate assumptions, optimize performance, and support product iterations.

• Tech & Innovation: Partner with data and engineering teams to explore and implement advanced features.

• Regulatory Awareness: Ensure product decisions align with industry regulations and data privacy standards.


Qualifications:

• Experience: 5-8 years of product management experience, ideally in financial related industries.

• Lifecycle Expertise: Proven track record leading products through the full lifecycle in agile environments.

• Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with comfort working with metrics, experimentation, and customer data.

• Technical Aptitude: Ability to work effectively with engineering and data teams; familiarity with concepts like APIs, data flows, and algorithmic features is helpful.

• Collaboration & Communication: Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills; strong ability to influence and align teams through storytelling and product narratives.We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Votorantim Cimentos North America (VCNA) hiring Financial Analyst in East York, Ontario, Canada
content_text:
WELCOME TO VCNA!

We are St Marys Cement, part of Votorantim Cimentos North America (VCNA),

As the North American operations of Votorantim Cimentos, a global building materials and sustainability solutions leader in 11 countries, we are helping to make a positive impact and are transforming our world. We have a culture built on solid partnerships, long-lasting relationships, and opportunities for those who want to learn, grow and be part of a diverse and dynamic culture.

With solutions that include cement, ready-mix concrete and aggregates, we help to build homes, highways, hospitals, buildings, bridges, and schools across the Canadian and U.S. Great Lakes region and Northeast United States. Our commitment to excellence can be seen in those who invest and believe in what we do, those who share their lives with us, those who trust in our deliveries and those committed to innovation and a sustainable future.

Every day, we have the chance to accomplish something new and you're invited to be part of it.

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

The Financial Analyst worked closely with Cement Finance team to ensure we deliver accurate and timeliness financial information for strategic decision.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

Supporting in consolidation of the annual 5 years Strategic Plan / Budget / Rolling Forecast and Monthly forecast and on-going budget adjustments throughout the year.Supporting and coordination in budgeting process for Terminals, SGA, Purchased Finished & other corporate items. Preparation of monthly reconciliation and journal entry for general ledger accounts related to Terminals, SG&A & Purchased Finished Products, ensuring timely follow up on any unusual or unexpected variances. Monitor and track joint venture GLS against key metrics, and recommend adjustments to improve accuracy of the information. Coordinates the standard costing and cash cost by product update with plant accounting manager. Prepare and analysis to investigate variation from previous year / budget / Forecast.Supporting on performing ad hoc reporting on monthly variance and trend analysis, reports on actual versus budget variances and works with cement finance team to identify and implement opportunities for cost savings, operating efficiencies, and best practices. Prepare various financial statements and/or reports.Work with the head office corporate finance staff and local plant management to: (a) establish and monitor system controls, (b) develop procedures to improve existing systems and (c) ensure that Corporate policies and procedures are being adhered to. Collaborate with cross-functional teams (e.g., sales, marketing, operations) to understand business drivers and align financial strategies. 

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

Minimum four-year business diploma from University or College with minimum five years progressively responsible finance/ accounting experience. Desired candidates that have successfully completed or participating in a recognized professional accounting program; CPA or like curriculum preferred.Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports, memo and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization, strong interpersonal skills, good communicator. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations; have the ability to control accounting administration through practical mathematical accounting principles. Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Ability to take financial data and controlling data and apply it to practical situations. To perform this job successfully, an individual must have intermediate to advanced skills with MS Office Word, and Power-Point; advanced skills in Excel applications. Experience with SAP R/3 or an Enterprise Resource Software would be a strong plus. Proven management and leadership skills.While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to stoop, crouch and/or kneel and climb with some height’s exposure of a moderate level. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 25 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus.While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is occasionally exposed to inclement weather conditions. The noise level in the office work environment is low with occasional higher levels in non-office areas including need for personal protective equipment as required. Periodic travel required including ability to obtain passport for periodic corporate Toronto office visits as necessary.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Being part of VCNA is being part of building famous landmarks such as Toronto's CN Tower, Roy Thompson Hall, Maple Leaf Gardens and the Darlington Nuclear Station and Ryerson Centre, St. Regis Chicago and 150 N. Riverside, Louis High-Speed Rail in Chicago and more Opportunities to collaborate with teams around the globe and growth opportunities in different areasTraining, professional developmentTuition reimbursement/assistance Competitive wages, vacation and holiday timeMedical, dental, vision, disability and life insuranceRRSP and DC (CAN) and 401K (U.S.) Lifeworks Employee Assistance Program (EAP): confidential support for you and your family (CAN)Educational scholarship program for dependents of regular salaried employees.Fertility drug coveragePaid Maternity Leave Top UpHybrid work model for certain positions

Salary Range: $98,505.02 - $123,131.28

This posting is for a vacant position.

OUR PEOPLE

We care about people - all people. At VCNA, we take safety, health and wellness seriously. We're dedicated to giving our employees a safe workplace, our neighbors a safe environment and our customers a high-quality and safe product. Safety first -and always!

Our VC Way reflects who we are, inspiring us to unite our culture and be our best: Our Way of Being: ethical and respectful, Our Way of Working: together with excellence and Our Way of Thriving: with the courage to transform.

INCLUSION AND EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYMENT

We have a results-oriented culture that values being open, honest, and authentic. It's part of our DNA. We are continually expanding our diverse and inclusive team by providing opportunities for everyone, regardless of race, ethnicity, age, gender, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, disability or economic status - a workplace where you can express your individuality and be your best self!

With solutions that include cement, ready-mix concrete and aggregates, we help to build homes, highways, hospitals, buildings, bridges, and schools across the Canadian and U.S. Great Lakes region and Northeast United States. title: Next Structural Integrity Inc. hiring Senior Mechanical Design Engineer in Greater Toronto Area, Canada
content_text:
Next Structural Integrity Inc., is a leading engineering company providing essential engineering services and solving complex problems for our clients in the Nuclear and Oil and Gas industries. We are a team of energetic and creative individuals offering the best engineering solutions and consulting services.
We strongly believe that every established engineering solution should exhibit the utmost quality and meet regulatory prerequisites. Our level of service not only makes our relationships mutually rewarding but facilitates lasting relationships with the parties involved. The skills that we have developed and the multi-level design and analysis capacity we have acquired while working across various industries inimitably qualify us as your go-to engineering partner.
Our growing company is seeking energetic, positive, and reliable Senior Mechanical Design Engineer to support our customers.
Responsibilities:
Responsible for supervising groups of specialized engineers in the energy sector.Maintaining a project timeline and completing tasks within the allocated time frames.Liaise with other discipline leads, project managers, contractors and clients to facilitate smooth flow of information for use in preparing preliminary and detailed design and provide design clarification solutions throughout the project.Reports and Calculations (test/hydraulic/equipment sizing/stress/FMEA, etc.).Technical Specifications (services/components/equipment, etc.).Demonstrated capability to manage a knowledge-based work unit.Extensive experience in the development of strategies and policies for the planning of programs with significant knowledge and experience in the principles of program/project evaluation, monitoring, measurement & verification, data analysis and report writing.Highly developed analytical, decision making, problem solving and conflict resolution skills, with a history of successfully demonstrating collaboration, teamwork, innovation, organization, coordination and planning skills.Strong leadership and management skills as evidenced by past successful performance, with demonstrated supervisory competencies including the ability to coach, hold accountable, mentor, engage and motivate staff.Demonstrated ability in preparing technical reports and deliverables to successful conclusion.
Qualifications:
Good knowledge of CANDU nuclear power plant design and operation as well as CANDU reactor components (specifically primary heat transport, feeder, calandria).Understanding of engineering change control process.Experience in compliance with regulatory standards and customer requirements.Experience in piping and equipment design.In depth knowledge of CSA N285.0, N286.7 and N289 as well as ASME Section III Subsections NB, NC, ND, NF, ASME B31.1, B31.3 and ASME Section VIII.Good understanding and experience with Engineering Change Control (ECC) process.Past experience that supports ASME Section III Appendix XXIII Qualification for Design Specification and Overpressure Protection Report is considered an asset.The successful candidate will be recognized by his/her peers for professionalism, superior performance, knowledge, expertise, and ability to work in team environment.Candidates must be pursuing towards P.Eng. designation and valid Nuclear site access.Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.The knowledge and skills required include successful completion of a university degree, Masters or PhD (Mechanical) and have a minimum of 3-5 years relevant practical experience in a project engineering or field-engineering role.

NSI is particularly interested in people who enjoy working on a variety of work and who are keen to continue to develop their knowledge and expertise.
If you believe you have the necessary knowledge, experience, and enthusiasm to succeed in this position, then we would like to hear from you.
We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. We are dedicated to maintaining a respectful, fair, and equitable work environment, and welcome submissions from all qualified applicants. We are committed to providing a barrier free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process it will be available upon request.
content_html:
Next Structural Integrity Inc., is a leading engineering company providing essential engineering services and solving complex problems for our clients in the Nuclear and Oil and Gas industries. We are a team of energetic and creative individuals offering the best engineering solutions and consulting services.


We strongly believe that every established engineering solution should exhibit the utmost quality and meet regulatory prerequisites. Our level of service not only makes our relationships mutually rewarding but facilitates lasting relationships with the parties involved. The skills that we have developed and the multi-level design and analysis capacity we have acquired while working across various industries inimitably qualify us as your go-to engineering partner.


Our growing company is seeking energetic, positive, and reliable Senior Mechanical Design Engineer to support our customers.


Responsibilities:


  • Responsible for supervising groups of specialized engineers in the energy sector.
  • Maintaining a project timeline and completing tasks within the allocated time frames.
  • Liaise with other discipline leads, project managers, contractors and clients to facilitate smooth flow of information for use in preparing preliminary and detailed design and provide design clarification solutions throughout the project.
  • Reports and Calculations (test/hydraulic/equipment sizing/stress/FMEA, etc.).
  • Technical Specifications (services/components/equipment, etc.).
  • Demonstrated capability to manage a knowledge-based work unit.
  • Extensive experience in the development of strategies and policies for the planning of programs with significant knowledge and experience in the principles of program/project evaluation, monitoring, measurement & verification, data analysis and report writing.
  • Highly developed analytical, decision making, problem solving and conflict resolution skills, with a history of successfully demonstrating collaboration, teamwork, innovation, organization, coordination and planning skills.
  • Strong leadership and management skills as evidenced by past successful performance, with demonstrated supervisory competencies including the ability to coach, hold accountable, mentor, engage and motivate staff.
  • Demonstrated ability in preparing technical reports and deliverables to successful conclusion.


Qualifications:


  • Good knowledge of CANDU nuclear power plant design and operation as well as CANDU reactor components (specifically primary heat transport, feeder, calandria).
  • Understanding of engineering change control process.
  • Experience in compliance with regulatory standards and customer requirements.
  • Experience in piping and equipment design.
  • In depth knowledge of CSA N285.0, N286.7 and N289 as well as ASME Section III Subsections NB, NC, ND, NF, ASME B31.1, B31.3 and ASME Section VIII.
  • Good understanding and experience with Engineering Change Control (ECC) process.
  • Past experience that supports ASME Section III Appendix XXIII Qualification for Design Specification and Overpressure Protection Report is considered an asset.
  • The successful candidate will be recognized by his/her peers for professionalism, superior performance, knowledge, expertise, and ability to work in team environment.
  • Candidates must be pursuing towards P.Eng. designation and valid Nuclear site access.
  • Candidates must be eligible to work in Canada.
  • The knowledge and skills required include successful completion of a university degree, Masters or PhD (Mechanical) and have a minimum of 3-5 years relevant practical experience in a project engineering or field-engineering role.



NSI is particularly interested in people who enjoy working on a variety of work and who are keen to continue to develop their knowledge and expertise.


If you believe you have the necessary knowledge, experience, and enthusiasm to succeed in this position, then we would like to hear from you.


We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. We are dedicated to maintaining a respectful, fair, and equitable work environment, and welcome submissions from all qualified applicants. We are committed to providing a barrier free workplace. If accommodation is required during the selection or interview process it will be available upon request.
contentPreview: Next Structural Integrity Inc., is a leading engineering company providing essential engineering services and solving complex problems for our clients in the Nuclear and Oil and Gas industries. We are...
relevanceReason: The candidate's software engineering experience is not a relevant match for this mechanical design engineering role in the nuclear and oil & gas industries. The job posting requires specific domain knowledge and experience in areas outside of the candidate's software engineering skillset, resulting in a poor match. It also requires experience in CANDU nuclear power plant design, which is not in the candidate's experience.
hardSkillsRequired: CANDU nuclear power plant design, ASME Section III, Piping and equipment design

title: Carousel hiring Marketing Manager in Montreal, Quebec, Canada
content_text:
We're hiring! Carousel is looking for a creative and driven Marketing Manager to help shape and amplify our brand across digital channels. If you're passionate about crafting compelling content, launching high-impact campaigns, and building a unified brand presence in a fast-paced fintech environment, we’d love to connect.
About Carousel:We help American and Canadian businesses transform their operations by collecting applicant data with unmatched speed. Operating at the intersection of fintech and data infrastructure, our modular ecosystem empowers businesses to build custom workflows that gather identity and financial information—seamlessly, securely, and at scale.
About the Role:As our Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for creating and managing high-impact digital content and campaigns that reflect and strengthen the Carousel brand. This is a hands-on role that blends strategy, creativity, and execution.
Key Responsibilities:Develop and deliver compelling digital content across channels (copy, visuals, social, web, and product)Own and evolve Carousel's brand identity across all platformsPlan, launch, and optimize digital marketing campaigns (paid and organic) to drive awareness, engagement, and conversionsCollaborate with product, design, and leadership teams to ensure consistent messaging and visual identityAnalyze performance data to generate insights, report on KPIs, and refine marketing strategies accordinglyThis is a hybrid position with in-office days at our Montreal, QC location.
What We’re Looking For:Minimum 5 years of experience in marketing, with a strong focus on digital and content marketingExceptional writing and editing skills, with a strong eye for design and detailProficiency with content and design tools such as Canva, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.Experience managing campaigns on platforms like Meta Ads (Facebook/Instagram), Google Ads, LinkedIn, etc.Strong understanding of marketing analytics and performance metricsAbility to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environmentCollaborative team player with a proactive mindset
What We Offer:A dynamic and entrepreneurial team environmentCompetitive salary and benefits packageOpportunities for professional growth and developmentA chance to shape the marketing strategy of a growing fintech brandVibrant office space in the heart of TMR
If this looks like it would be a good fit for you, we want to hear from you!

We're hiring! Carousel is looking for a creative and driven Marketing Manager to help shape and amplify our brand across digital channels. If you're passionate about crafting compelling content, launching high-impact campaigns, and building a unified brand presence in a fast-paced fintech environment, we’d love to connect.


About Carousel:

We help American and Canadian businesses transform their operations by collecting applicant data with unmatched speed. Operating at the intersection of fintech and data infrastructure, our modular ecosystem empowers businesses to build custom workflows that gather identity and financial information—seamlessly, securely, and at scale.


About the Role:

As our Marketing Manager, you will be responsible for creating and managing high-impact digital content and campaigns that reflect and strengthen the Carousel brand. This is a hands-on role that blends strategy, creativity, and execution.


Key Responsibilities:

  • Develop and deliver compelling digital content across channels (copy, visuals, social, web, and product)
  • Own and evolve Carousel's brand identity across all platforms
  • Plan, launch, and optimize digital marketing campaigns (paid and organic) to drive awareness, engagement, and conversions
  • Collaborate with product, design, and leadership teams to ensure consistent messaging and visual identity
  • Analyze performance data to generate insights, report on KPIs, and refine marketing strategies accordingly
  • This is a hybrid position with in-office days at our Montreal, QC location.

  • Minimum 5 years of experience in marketing, with a strong focus on digital and content marketing
  • Exceptional writing and editing skills, with a strong eye for design and detail
  • Proficiency with content and design tools such as Canva, Figma, Adobe Creative Suite, etc.
  • Experience managing campaigns on platforms like Meta Ads (Facebook/Instagram), Google Ads, LinkedIn, etc.
  • Strong understanding of marketing analytics and performance metrics
  • Ability to manage multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Collaborative team player with a proactive mindset


What We Offer:

  • A dynamic and entrepreneurial team environment
  • Competitive salary and benefits package
  • Opportunities for professional growth and development
  • A chance to shape the marketing strategy of a growing fintech brand
  • Vibrant office space in the heart of TMR


If this looks like it would be a good fit for you, we want to hear from you!

title: Querentia hiring Project Manager in Saskatchewan, Canada
content_text:
We are seeking an experienced Project Manager with a strong background in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector to support our client, a leading midstream operator with operations in Saskatchewan. This role will focus on identifying and executing cost reduction and revenue enhancement opportunities, with particular emphasis on optimizing power purchase costs through negotiations and commercial arrangements. Key Responsibilities:Lead initiatives aimed at reducing power-related costs through effective contract negotiations and alternative commercial structures.Partner with stakeholders to analyze current power purchase agreements and identify opportunities for savings.Develop and implement commercial strategies aligned with organizational cost-reduction and revenue-enhancement goals.Provide project management oversight to ensure deliverables are executed on time and within scope.Collaborate cross-functionally with operations, finance, and executive leadership to drive outcomes.Prepare recommendations and present findings to leadership teams.
Qualifications & Experience:Proven experience as a Project Manager within the Power & Utilities sector.Strong background in contract negotiation, commercial arrangements, and cost optimization strategies.Experience working with midstream operators or energy companies preferred.Excellent analytical, communication, and stakeholder management skills.Ability to operate effectively in both onsite and remote settings.PMP or equivalent certification is an asset.
content_html:
We are seeking an experienced Project Manager with a strong background in the Power & Utilities (P&U) sector to support our client, a leading midstream operator with operations in Saskatchewan. This role will focus on identifying and executing cost reduction and revenue enhancement opportunities, with particular emphasis on optimizing power purchase costs through negotiations and commercial arrangements.

Key Responsibilities:

  • Lead initiatives aimed at reducing power-related costs through effective contract negotiations and alternative commercial structures.
  • Partner with stakeholders to analyze current power purchase agreements and identify opportunities for savings.
  • Develop and implement commercial strategies aligned with organizational cost-reduction and revenue-enhancement goals.
  • Provide project management oversight to ensure deliverables are executed on time and within scope.
  • Collaborate cross-functionally with operations, finance, and executive leadership to drive outcomes.
  • Prepare recommendations and present findings to leadership teams.


Qualifications & Experience:

  • Proven experience as a Project Manager within the Power & Utilities sector.
  • Strong background in contract negotiation, commercial arrangements, and cost optimization strategies.
  • Experience working with midstream operators or energy companies preferred.
  • Excellent analytical, communication, and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to operate effectively in both onsite and remote settings.
  • PMP or equivalent certification is an asset.

Therefore, this is a poor match.

title: Ontario Health | Santé Ontario hiring Coordinator, Accounts Payable in Toronto, Ontario, Canada
content_text:
Pour obtenir une traduction en français de l’offre d’emploi suivante, veuillez envoyer un courriel à careers@ontariohealth.ca. Les demandes seront traitées dans un délai de trois jours ouvrables et la période de dépôt des demandes sera prolongée de trois jours.

To obtain a French translation of the following job posting, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca. Requests will be addressed within three business days, and the application window will be extended by three business days.

At Ontario Health, we are committed to developing a strong organizational culture that connects and inspires all team members across the province. Our vision is that together, we will be a leader in health and wellness for all. Our mission is to connect the health system to drive improved and equitable health outcomes, experiences and value. How we work together is reflected through our five values: integrity, inspiration, tenacity, humility and care.  

What Ontario Health offers:  

Achieving your career goals is a priority to us. Benefits of working at Ontario Health may include the following based on employment type: 

Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage from your first day  a health care spending or wellness spending account a premium defined benefit pension plan  three personal days and two float days annually  three weeks’ vacation to start (for individual contributors), increasing to four weeks after two years career development opportunities  a collaborative values-based team culture  a wellness program a hybrid working model  participation in Communities of Inclusion   

Want to make a difference in your career?  Consider this opportunity.  

Ontario Health is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accounts Payable Coordinator to join our dynamic Finance team. Reporting to the Finance Manager, this role is part of a team responsible for processing payments exceeding $4 billion annually to suppliers, health service providers, and individuals.

As an Accounts Payable Coordinator, you’ll play a key role in ensuring that all payment requests are valid, complete, and compliant with internal policies and controls. You’ll apply professional judgment and skepticism to identify risks and errors, and contribute to maintaining the integrity of Ontario Health’s financial operations. This is a fast-paced, high-impact role where your commitment to accuracy, customer service, and continuous improvement will be highly valued.

Here Is What You Will Be Doing

Review, validate, and enter supplier invoices, ensuring accurate matching with purchase orders and verifying authenticity.Process various non-invoice payments, including honorariums and funding to health service providers and individuals.Assess expense reimbursements for compliance with Ontario Health policies, union agreements, and government directives.Apply sound financial judgment and professional skepticism to detect and escalate potential fraud or errors.Reconcile invoice discrepancies and supplier statements independently, escalating complex issues as needed.Proactively follow up on missing information and educate internal stakeholders on policies and procedures.Support internal and external audits by providing required documentation and insights.Maintain advanced knowledge of Workday ERP functionality and continuously seek opportunities to enhance efficiency.Collaborate across Finance and other departments to resolve issues and improve processes.Deliver excellent service to internal and external clients, building strong working relationships.Perform cross-functional duties and uphold internal controls to prevent and detect fraudulent activity.

Education And Experience

Here is what you will need to be successful:

1–5 years of experience in Accounts Payable or accounting, preferably in large, complex organizations.College certificate or bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration.Accounting designation (or actively pursuing) is preferred.Experience with Workday ERP is preferred.Familiarity with the Management Board of Cabinet Travel, Meal and Hospitality Expense Directive is an asset.

Knowledge And Skills

Strong financial and business judgment, with a high level of professional skepticism.Exceptional attention to detail and analytical problem-solving abilities.Ability to identify and escalate issues appropriately.Effective communication and interpersonal skills; thrives in team environments.Motivated to meet deadlines and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.Commitment to continuous improvement and learning.Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.High ethical standards and discretion when handling sensitive information.Strong customer focus and dedication to quality service.

 MB1

#OH-IND-DIG 

Location: Ontario (currently hybrid; subject to change)

Employment Type

Permanent Full time

Contract Length

N/A

Salary Band

Band 2

External Application Deadline Date

September 10, 2025

All applicants must be a resident of Ontario to be considered for roles at Ontario Health.

Ontario Health encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, Métis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; members of Black and racialized groups; 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary individuals; and people living with disabilities. 

Ontario Health is an accessible employer, and we offer accommodation in all aspects of employment, including the recruitment process. If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca and a member of the team will connect with you within 48 hours.

Pour obtenir une traduction en français de l’offre d’emploi suivante, veuillez envoyer un courriel à careers@ontariohealth.ca. Les demandes seront traitées dans un délai de trois jours ouvrables et la période de dépôt des demandes sera prolongée de trois jours.

To obtain a French translation of the following job posting, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca. Requests will be addressed within three business days, and the application window will be extended by three business days.

At Ontario Health, we are committed to developing a strong organizational culture that connects and inspires all team members across the province. Our vision is that together, we will be a leader in health and wellness for all. Our mission is to connect the health system to drive improved and equitable health outcomes, experiences and value. How we work together is reflected through our five values: integrity, inspiration, tenacity, humility and care.  

What Ontario Health offers:  

Achieving your career goals is a priority to us. Benefits of working at Ontario Health may include the following based on employment type: 

  • Fully paid medical, dental and vision coverage from your first day 
  • a health care spending or wellness spending account
  • a premium defined benefit pension plan 
  • three personal days and two float days annually 
  • three weeks’ vacation to start (for individual contributors), increasing to four weeks after two years
  • career development opportunities 
  • a collaborative values-based team culture 
  • a wellness program
  • a hybrid working model 
  • participation in Communities of Inclusion  

Want to make a difference in your career?  Consider this opportunity.  

Ontario Health is seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Accounts Payable Coordinator to join our dynamic Finance team. Reporting to the Finance Manager, this role is part of a team responsible for processing payments exceeding $4 billion annually to suppliers, health service providers, and individuals.

As an Accounts Payable Coordinator, you’ll play a key role in ensuring that all payment requests are valid, complete, and compliant with internal policies and controls. You’ll apply professional judgment and skepticism to identify risks and errors, and contribute to maintaining the integrity of Ontario Health’s financial operations. This is a fast-paced, high-impact role where your commitment to accuracy, customer service, and continuous improvement will be highly valued.

Here Is What You Will Be Doing

  • Review, validate, and enter supplier invoices, ensuring accurate matching with purchase orders and verifying authenticity.
  • Process various non-invoice payments, including honorariums and funding to health service providers and individuals.
  • Assess expense reimbursements for compliance with Ontario Health policies, union agreements, and government directives.
  • Apply sound financial judgment and professional skepticism to detect and escalate potential fraud or errors.
  • Reconcile invoice discrepancies and supplier statements independently, escalating complex issues as needed.
  • Proactively follow up on missing information and educate internal stakeholders on policies and procedures.
  • Support internal and external audits by providing required documentation and insights.
  • Maintain advanced knowledge of Workday ERP functionality and continuously seek opportunities to enhance efficiency.
  • Collaborate across Finance and other departments to resolve issues and improve processes.
  • Deliver excellent service to internal and external clients, building strong working relationships.
  • Perform cross-functional duties and uphold internal controls to prevent and detect fraudulent activity.

Education And Experience

Here is what you will need to be successful:

  • 1–5 years of experience in Accounts Payable or accounting, preferably in large, complex organizations.
  • College certificate or bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration.
  • Accounting designation (or actively pursuing) is preferred.
  • Experience with Workday ERP is preferred.
  • Familiarity with the Management Board of Cabinet Travel, Meal and Hospitality Expense Directive is an asset.

Knowledge And Skills

  • Strong financial and business judgment, with a high level of professional skepticism.
  • Exceptional attention to detail and analytical problem-solving abilities.
  • Ability to identify and escalate issues appropriately.
  • Effective communication and interpersonal skills; thrives in team environments.
  • Motivated to meet deadlines and manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced setting.
  • Commitment to continuous improvement and learning.
  • Proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook.
  • High ethical standards and discretion when handling sensitive information.
  • Strong customer focus and dedication to quality service.

Ontario Health encourages applications from candidates who are First Nations, Métis, Inuit, and urban Indigenous; Francophone; members of Black and racialized groups; 2SLGBTQIA+ communities; trans and nonbinary individuals; and people living with disabilities.

Ontario Health is an accessible employer, and we offer accommodation in all aspects of employment, including the recruitment process. If you require a disability related accommodation in order to participate in the recruitment process, please email careers@ontariohealth.ca and a member of the team will connect with you within 48 hours.

title: Groupe Conseil UDA Inc. hiring Accounting Analyst in Saint-Charles-sur-Richelieu, Quebec, Canada
content_text:
UDA Consulting Group is actively seeking an accounting analyst to join its financial team. This essential role involves the meticulous management of accounting and administrative operations, with a strong emphasis on internal collaboration and rigorous financial reporting.

Teleworking available up to 3 days per week, with the option to work from our offices located in Saint-Charles-sur-Richelieu or Quebec City.

Why choose us

For our human-scale work culture and climate, both enjoyable and enriching in terms of developing skills in the environment, agriculture, forestry, and hydrogeology, where people can pursue their passion in varied and stimulating project contexts, and where their contributions are recognized and valued;For our multitude of career opportunities to continue to grow and develop in an environment conducive to professional growth (personalized training plan, development and skills acquisition);For our significant contribution to the success of development projects in Quebec by ensuring compliance with applicable environments and regulations;For our competitive compensation and comprehensive employee-focused benefits package (group insurance plan, pension plan, telemedicine, EFAP, cell phone provided, reimbursement of professional association membership fees, reimbursement of mileage traveled according to internal policy, social club activities, etc.);For our flexible working conditions aimed at balancing our professional and personal lives (teleworking offered up to 100% of the time depending on the position, condensed schedule, annual leave, etc.).

Job Responsibilities

Assist with the financial management of projects in the Daily.Monitor and invoicing between the various group entities, as well as proactively manage customer and supplier accounts.Accurately prepare various annual and periodic financial reports and perform the necessary bank reconciliations.Collaborate closely with project managers to ensure effective monitoring of ongoing projects.Work with the invoicing team to ensure timely and accurate delivery of documents to clients, especially during peak periods.Actively contribute to the development of budgets and financial forecasts, working closely with operational teams.Analyze and present financial metrics and relevant key performance indicators for various business areas.

Other Responsibilities

Support the monthly accounting closing process and participate in audit preparation. annual.Continuously evaluate accounting processes to make recommendations to improve operational efficiency.Perform other accounting-related tasks.

Requirements And Education

Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Accounting profile.0 to 5 years of relevant experience in a similar position.Excellent proficiency in Office Suite tools, particularly Excel.Ability to work under pressure and coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously, while meeting tight deadlines.Ability to communicate effectively and work in a team.Rigor, proactivity, and attention to detail in work methods.Discretion and respect for confidentiality.Autonomy and ability to learn new skills.Ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment.Results-oriented while fostering collaboration and able to build harmonious relationships with peers, clients, and partners.Integrity, collaboration, accountability, and respect for deadlines.
content_html:
UDA Consulting Group is actively seeking an accounting analyst to join its financial team. This essential role involves the meticulous management of accounting and administrative operations, with a strong emphasis on internal collaboration and rigorous financial reporting.

Teleworking available up to 3 days per week, with the option to work from our offices located in Saint-Charles-sur-Richelieu or Quebec City.

Why choose us

  • For our human-scale work culture and climate, both enjoyable and enriching in terms of developing skills in the environment, agriculture, forestry, and hydrogeology, where people can pursue their passion in varied and stimulating project contexts, and where their contributions are recognized and valued;
  • For our multitude of career opportunities to continue to grow and develop in an environment conducive to professional growth (personalized training plan, development and skills acquisition);
  • For our significant contribution to the success of development projects in Quebec by ensuring compliance with applicable environments and regulations;
  • For our competitive compensation and comprehensive employee-focused benefits package (group insurance plan, pension plan, telemedicine, EFAP, cell phone provided, reimbursement of professional association membership fees, reimbursement of mileage traveled according to internal policy, social club activities, etc.);
  • For our flexible working conditions aimed at balancing our professional and personal lives (teleworking offered up to 100% of the time depending on the position, condensed schedule, annual leave, etc.).

Job Responsibilities

  • Assist with the financial management of projects in the Daily.
  • Monitor and invoicing between the various group entities, as well as proactively manage customer and supplier accounts.
  • Accurately prepare various annual and periodic financial reports and perform the necessary bank reconciliations.
  • Collaborate closely with project managers to ensure effective monitoring of ongoing projects.
  • Work with the invoicing team to ensure timely and accurate delivery of documents to clients, especially during peak periods.
  • Actively contribute to the development of budgets and financial forecasts, working closely with operational teams.
  • Analyze and present financial metrics and relevant key performance indicators for various business areas.

Other Responsibilities

  • Support the monthly accounting closing process and participate in audit preparation. annual.
  • Continuously evaluate accounting processes to make recommendations to improve operational efficiency.
  • Perform other accounting-related tasks.

Requirements And Education

  • Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Accounting profile.
  • 0 to 5 years of relevant experience in a similar position.
  • Excellent proficiency in Office Suite tools, particularly Excel.
  • Ability to work under pressure and coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously, while meeting tight deadlines.
  • Ability to communicate effectively and work in a team.
  • Rigor, proactivity, and attention to detail in work methods.
  • Discretion and respect for confidentiality.
  • Autonomy and ability to learn new skills.
  • Ability to adapt to a constantly changing environment.
  • Results-oriented while fostering collaboration and able to build harmonious relationships with peers, clients, and partners.
  • Integrity, collaboration, accountability, and respect for deadlines.
